note.p: Birth: Mount Vernon, Liverpool, Lancashire, England (30 December 1850)
Death: Shide, Isle of Wight (30 or 31 July 1913)
Education: King's College, London; Royal School of Mines

Career: Studied mineralogy in Freiburg; investigated mineral resources of Newfoundland and Labrador (1872-1874); collected skeletons of the great auk from Funk Island, Newfoundland; Professor of Geology and Mining, Imperial College of Tokyo (1875); studied earthquakes; founded the Seismological Society of Japan; returned to England (1895); Secretary, Seismological Society
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1913-1914 vol 89 pp xxii-xxv signed by J P
Notes: DNB (MP) and DSB give death date as 31 July 1913
References: G Ferrari and A McConnell, 'Robert Mallet and the 'Great Neapolitan earthquake' of 1857 in NR 2005 vol 59 pp 45-64
